Tracking Scripts¶

create path¶

class scripts.pt_scripts.create_path.CreatePath(data_dir='')[source]¶

Create reference path and trajectory.

path_1()[source]¶

This function generates a circular path with a specified radius and number of points.

path_2()[source]¶

This function generates a path consisting of two straight lines connected at a right angle.

generate_curved_waypoints(num_waypoints=5, max_x=20, max_y=20, smoothness=3)[source]¶

create random curved path

Args:
num_waypoints (int, optional): number of waypoints. Defaults to 5. max_x (int, optional): max x value. Defaults to 20. max_y (int, optional): max y value. Defaults to 20. smoothness (int, optional): smoothness. Defaults to 3.
from_json(ind=1, name=None)[source]¶

create reference trajectory from json file

Args:
ind (int, optional): _description_. Defaults to 1. name (_type_, optional): _description_. Defaults to None.
from_plan(plan)[source]¶
post_proc()[source]¶

calculate metadata for reference trajectory.

plot()[source]¶

The function plots a line connecting a series of waypoints and marks the start point with a green circle.

to_json(name='path')[source]¶

This function converts a set of x, y, and yaw values into a JSON file.

speed_profile(robot)[source]¶

calculate linear speed profile

Args:
robot (Robot): Robot object
get_pose_vec(ind)[source]¶

returns x, y, yaw of waypoint[ind]

Args:
ind (int): index of the waypoint
Returns:
list: [x, y, yaw]

create path from rviz¶

class scripts.pt_scripts.create_path_rviz.CreatePathRviz[source]¶

The CreatePathRviz class is responsible for creating and publishing a path in RViz based on received poses, and saving the path as a JSON file.

pose_callback(msg)[source]¶

Callback function for received poses

Args:
msg (PoseWithCovarianceStamped): PoseWithCovarianceStamped

plotting¶

class scripts.pt_scripts.plotting.Plotting(ref_traj, r_pose, goal)[source]¶

The Plotting class is used to create and update a plot for path tracking, and can also save the final plot to a file.

initialize()[source]¶
update_plot(dx, dy, r_pose, lookahead_point)[source]¶

update plot based on last robot pose and heading

Args:
dx (float): x displacement in last timestep dy (float): y displacement in last timestep r_pose (pose): robot pose lookahead_point (pose): look ahead pose.
plot_final(pic_dir, rec_traj_x, rec_traj_y)[source]¶

plot traversed and reference trajectory

Args:
path (str): pictures directory rec_traj_x (list[float]): x coords of the traversed trajectory rec_traj_y (list[float]): y coords of the traversed trajectory

The ros_initialize function initializes the necessary ROS components and publishers.

start(ref_traj)[source]¶

This function sets the reference trajectory, publishes waypoints, and logs the start time.

Parameters:ref_traj – ref_traj is a reference trajectory that the robot will follow.
